title: Sheffield United goalkeeper Dean Henderson receives his first England call up
text:
Sheffield United goalkeeper Dean Henderson has been given his first England call up after Aston Villa's Tom Heaton pulled out with injury.

Three Lions boss Gareth Southgate has called upon the 22-year-old after catching the eye with three clean sheets, having played all eight games of the campaign so far for the Blades.

Heaton picked up the injury during Villa's 5-1 thrashing of Norwich on the weekend and has now returned to his club for assessment.

Dean Henderson has won his first England call up after Gareth Southgate lost Heaton to injury

Henderson, who is being loaned to Bramall Lane from Manchester United for the second season in a row, has represented England at U16, U17, U20 and U21 level.

He will now be in contention to face Bulgaria and the Czech Republic in the Euro 2020 Qualifiers over the next week.

The former Middlesbrough boss will choose from Henderson, Jordan Pickford and Nick Pope

Heaton was forced to withdraw from the squad after suffering an injury against Norwich

The shot stopper has expressed his delight after being informed of the news all English footballers dream of hearing.

He wrote on Twitter: 'This is what dreams are made of... it’s a dream come true to receive my first senior call up!!'

This is what dreams are made of... it’s a dream come true to receive my first @England senior call up!! 🔜🔛🔝 pic.twitter.com/gmzUrJSvZk — Dean Henderson (@deanhenderson) October 8, 2019

Manager Southgate may choose to experiment with his goalkeepers for the upcoming games, with no clear number one currently cemented. His other two options are Everton's Jordan Pickford and Burnley's Nick Pope.

England take on the Czech Republic in Prague on Friday night, before travelling to Sofia to play Bulgaria on Monday October 14.
